result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin T. Allain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
MCJ with EMP for treatment and/or work. 45 days to report
Concurrent with: one another and Ct.1 in 19CM1768

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin T. Allain

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Becca. 
Case Called: 3:40 pm. 
INCLUDES: 21CM1055, 21CM1182, 22CM118, 22CM372, 22CM591, 22CM592 & 19CM1768.

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.
Defendant Justin Allain appears in person, in custody and with Attorney Julianne Lennon.

Date/Time set for Plea/Sent in 21CM1055, 21CM1182, 22CM118, 22CM372, 22CM591, 22CM592 and Sentencing After Revocation in 19CM1768.

COURT addresses competency - report has been filed and has been reviewed by Court. COURT adopts report and findings set within. COURT FINDS deft. competent to proceed to plea/sent today.  

VRCW - Court notes impact statement has been filed. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. 

State moves to:  
21CM1182:
Ct. 1 (Lewd. Lascivious Behavior / Exposure / Repeater) >> DRI. 
Ct. 2 (Bail Jumping / Misdemeanor / Repeater) >> DRI.
Ct. 3 (Bail Jumping / Misdemeanor / Repeater) >> DRI.

22CM118:
Ct. 3 (Bail Jumping / Misdemeanor / Repeater) >> DRI. 

22CM372:
Ct. 2 (Bail Jumping / Misdemeanor / Repeater) >> DRI.
Ct. 3 (Bail Jumping / Misdemeanor / Repeater) >> DRI.
Ct. 4 (Bail Jumping / Misdemeanor / Repeater) >> DRI.

22CM591:
Ct. 3 (Possession of THC / Repeater) >> DRI.
Ct. 4 (Bail Jumping / Misdemeanor / Repeater) >> DRI.
Ct. 5 (Bail Jumping / Misdemeanor / Repeater) >> DRI.
Ct. 6 (Bail Jumping / Misdemeanor / Repeater) >> DRI.

22CM592:
Ct. 1 (Disorderly Conduct / Repeater) >> DRI.
Ct. 2 (Bail Jumping / Misdemeanor / Repeater) >> DRI.
Ct. 3 (Bail Jumping / Misdemeanor / Repeater) >> DRI.
Ct. 4 (Bail Jumping / Misdemeanor / Repeater) >> DRI.

*** COURT GRANTS ABOVE ***


PLEA: 
21CM1055:
Ct. 1 (Possession of THC / Repeater) >> GUILTY. 

22CM118:
Ct. 1 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer / Repeater) >> GUILTY. 
Ct. 2 (Bail Jumping / Misdemeanor / Repeater) >> GUILTY. 
Ct. 4 (Disorderly Conduct / Repeater) >> GUILTY. 

22CM372:
Ct. 1 (Disorderly Conduct / Repeater) >> GUILTY.

22CM591:
Ct. 1 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling / Repeater) >> GUILTY. 
Ct. 2 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling / Repeater) >> GUILTY. 


Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 7 months MCJ on each count to run concurrent to one another and Ct. 1 in 19CM1768. Court Costs including DNA sample and surcharge. Court finds 115 days credit. Court allows 45 days to report. EMP for treatment and/or work.

Sentencing After Revocation in 19CM1768: Ct. 1 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer / Repeater) >> COURT ORDERS: 9 months MCJ concurrent to above plead to cases. Court finds 9 months credit. Any outstanding court costs are converted to a civil judgment.

Adjourned: 4:09 pm.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amy. 
Called: 9:36 a.m. 
INCLUDES 21CM1055, 21CM1182, 22CM118, 22CM372, 22CM591, 22CM592.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person from MCJ with Atty Julie Lennon. 

Date and time set for FPT; VRCW. 
COURT has reviewed report of Dr. Brooke Lundbohm (Doc 18 in 21CM1055); report finds deft competent to proceed. 
Atty Lennon has reviewed report; defendant is ready to accept plea however paperwork has not been completed. Atty Lennon would like more time to discuss competency report with defendant and does not want to stipulate to competency at this time. 

COURT sets CC on 8/10/22 at 8:05 a.m. to set tentative plea date. 

Adj:  9:39 a.m.

2:33 PM 
Clerk: Amy. 
INCLUDES 21CM1055, 21CM1182, 22CM118, 22CM372, 22CM591, 22CM592.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person from MCJ with Atty Lennon. 

Date and time set for bond modification in 22CM591/22CM592.
ADA Coonen makes objections to bond modification.  
Atty Lennon makes arguments re: motion. 
COURT makes findings and denies bond modification.  

Next hearing>>PTC 7/19/22 at 1:20 p.m. 

Adj:  2:41 p.m.
Examining psychologist's report- Brooke E. Lundbohm, Psy.D.
Re: Order for Competency Examination by DHS

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  3:43 p.m. 
INCLUDES 21CM1055, 21CM1182, 22CM118, 22CM372.
State appears by ADA Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Julianne Lennon. 

Date and time set for defense motion for competency evaluation; VRCW. 
Atty Lennon is making request for comptency evaluation.  
State takes no position. 

COURT makes findings and order competency examination be completed by WFU.  
COURT directs Atty Lennon to draft Order for Court signature. 

COURT sets CC for 6/29/22 at 8:05 a.m. to set review hearing to check status of report. 

Adj:  3:49 p.m.
